perturbation.original_text: 5.2 The Principal shall pay the commission fee for each delivered batch of Commodity to the Company's account within 30 (thirty) banking days after the Delivery Date.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.2 The Principal shall pay the commission fee for each delivered batch of Commodity to the Company's account within 60 (sixty) banking days after the Delivery Date.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the payment deadline. Originally, the Principal has 30 days to pay the commission fee. Now, the deadline is extended to 60 days, creating uncertainty and potential disputes regarding the enforceable payment term.

perturbation.original_text: 5.3 The payment shall be made in accordance with the invoice presented by the Company and the tax invoice (original or a fax copy) in Tenge at the official exchange rate of the National Bank of the Republic of Kazakhstan effective on the Delivery Date in accordance with item 4.1.vii.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.3 The payment shall be made in accordance with the invoice presented by the Company and the tax invoice (original or a fax copy) in US dollars at the official exchange rate of the National Bank of the Republic of Kazakhstan effective on the date of the invoice.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by altering the currency of payment and the reference date for the exchange rate. The original text specifies payment in Tenge, while the modified text dictates payment in US dollars. Furthermore, the original text uses the Delivery Date for the exchange rate, while the modified text uses the invoice date. This could lead to disputes over which currency and exchange rate should be applied.

perturbation.original_text: 9.1 In accordance with items 9.3, 9.4, and 10.3, this Contract shall come into force on the Effective Date, remain effective throughout the Initial Term, and be prolonged, or further extended automatically for a period of 12 months, each such extension commencing at the end of the last day of the Initial Term or the relevant anniversary thereof, unless either Party serves written notice of termination on the other Party at least 65 days prior to the end of the Initial Term, or any subsequent extension.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.1 In accordance with items 9.3, 9.4, and 10.3, this Contract shall come into force on the Effective Date, remain effective throughout the Initial Term, and be prolonged, or further extended automatically for a period of 6 months, each such extension commencing at the end of the last day of the Initial Term or the relevant anniversary thereof, unless either Party serves written notice of termination on the other Party at least 30 days prior to the end of the Initial Term, or any subsequent extension.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the automatic extension period and the notice period for termination. The original text specifies an automatic extension of 12 months and a 65-day notice period for termination. The modified text reduces these to 6 months and 30 days, respectively. This creates uncertainty and potential disputes regarding the actual term of the contract and the requirements for termination.
